textBeforeTable: ERT/SWAT Radio Channel Plan Channel 6 is repeated in Metrorail tunnels. Channels 10, 11, and 12 are used almost exclusively in simplex (i.e., talk-around/direct) mode. Add 3 MHz to the frequency for each channel (1-12) to obtain the repeater input frequency. The portable radios are 16-channel Motorola Saber radios.  The portables' channels 1-8 are repeated county police channels 1-8 and the portables' channels 9-16 are talk-around ("direct") for county police channels 1-8. County police mobile radios are Motorola Spectra radios.  These radios have both repeated and talk-around ("direct") channels for each of the 12 channels below. There are no separate channel numbers for talk-around on the mobile radios per se; repeater/direct is indicated by a letter following the channel number on the mobile radios' display (e.g., channel "11R" and "11D").  The mobiles also have a "scan" mode which allows officers to monitor the other channels. Channel numbering varies among radios, particularly portables. Channel 7 is repeated above ground throughout the county and in Metrorail tunnels.
